page.title: 06 SHOPPING HISTORY
page.content: Exning is a large village two miles North West of Newmarket.It contains several small village shops. The sort of shops that were in Exning around the date 1844 are not that different to those that are still around now.There are still the local shops like the post office,bakers and coalmerchants, all of which are still used. There are some shops that can not be found in Exning like the Wheel makers and tailor's. Other shops that could be found in Exning in the year 1844 but are not found today are ...... A Blacksmith and Carpenters. There was a market in Exning but the traders moved to Newmarket, because Newmarket was on the main road,and more people passed through Newmarket than Exning, so the market did more trade.
